intro: Cynorkis brachystachya, commonly known as the short-stalked orchid, is a terrestrial orchid species native to southern Africa. It typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom during the late summer to early autumn. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to store moisture, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. Cynorkis brachystachya is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate floral structure.
